sun.name: The Sun
sun.description: The Sun is a G-type main-sequence star that accounts for 99.86% of the mass of the entire Solar System.
sun.funFact: Every second, the Sun converts 600 million tons of hydrogen into helium, releasing energy equivalent to millions of nuclear bombs!

planets.name: Mercury
planets.atmosphere: Trace amounts of Oxygen, Sodium, Hydrogen, Helium
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest planet and closest to the Sun. It's a rocky, cratered celestial body with extreme temperatures.
planets.funFact: Mercury orbits the Sun 3 times for every 2 rotations it makes on its axis - a 3:2 spin-orbit resonance!

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is the hottest planet with a thick toxic atmosphere and clouds of sulfuric acid. It's similar in size to Earth but with hellish conditions.
planets.funFact: Venus rotates backwards compared to most planets and is the only planet that rotates slower than it orbits!

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is our home planet, the only known world to harbor life. It has a diverse ecosystem and is protected by a magnetic field.
planets.funFact: Earth's core is as hot as the surface of the Sun! The continents are slowly drifting at about 2.5 cm per year.
planets.composition: Iron-nickel core, silicate rock mantle, water oceans

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars, the Red Planet, is a cold, dusty desert world with the largest volcano in the solar system: Olympus Mons.
planets.funFact: A day on Mars is almost identical to Earth's - 24 hours 37 minutes. Scientists are seriously considering Mars colonization!
planets.composition: Iron oxide-rich silicate rock core and mantle
planets.surfaceComposition: Rust (Iron oxide), basaltic rock, polar ice caps
planets.magneticField: Remnant magnetism - no active magnetic field

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet and a gas giant with stunning cloud bands and the famous Great Red Spot storm.
planets.ringDescription: Faint ring system composed mainly of dust
planets.funFact: Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a storm larger than Earth that has been raging for at least 350 years!
planets.composition: Hydrogen and Helium gas with rocky core
planets.magneticField: Extremely strong - second strongest in solar system

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is famous for its spectacular ring system made of ice and rock. It's the second-largest planet.
planets.ringDescription: Complex ring system with 7 main rings composed of icy particles and rock boulders
planets.composition: Hydrogen and Helium gas with rocky core
planets.surfaceComposition: No solid surface - gaseous atmosphere with ammonia crystals
planets.funFact: Saturn's density is so low that it would float in water! Titan has methane rain and liquid hydrocarbon lakes.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is an ice giant that rotates on its side! It has a faint ring system and extreme weather patterns.
planets.ringDescription: Faint ring system with 13 known rings
planets.funFact: Uranus rotates on its side with a tilt of 98 degrees, likely due to a collision early in the solar system's history!
planets.composition: Water, methane, and ammonia ices with rocky core
planets.surfaceComposition: No solid surface - liquid water and methane mantle
planets.magneticField: Unusual tilted magnetic field at 59Â° angle

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the windiest planet with the fastest winds in the solar system, reaching 2,100 km/h.
planets.ringDescription: 5 main rings with several incomplete ring arcs
planets.funFact: Neptune's Great Dark Spot was a storm system larger than Earth that mysteriously disappeared when observed again!
planets.composition: Water, methane, and ammonia ices with rocky core
planets.surfaceComposition: No solid surface - liquid water and methane mantle

asteroidBelt.name: Asteroid Belt
asteroidBelt.funFact: The asteroid belt is mostly empty space! If you were somehow inside it, you'd rarely see another asteroid. Ceres alone comprises 1/3 of all asteroid belt mass!

kuiperBelt.name: Kuiper Belt
kuiperBelt.funFact: The Kuiper Belt is home to comets! Many short-period comets originate from this icy region. It's named after Dutch-American astronomer Gerard Kuiper.

dwarfPlanets.name: Ceres
dwarfPlanets.description: The largest object in the asteroid belt and a dwarf planet. Ceres contains 1/3 of the asteroid belt's total mass.
dwarfPlanets.funFact: Ceres may have a subsurface ocean of water! NASA's Dawn spacecraft discovered bright spots that might be salt deposits.

dwarfPlanets.name: Pluto
dwarfPlanets.description: Once considered the 9th planet, Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006. It has an unusual tilted and elliptical orbit.
dwarfPlanets.funFact: Pluto's largest moon Charon is so large relative to Pluto that they form a binary system! Pluto has a nitrogen ice heart-shaped region.

dwarfPlanets.name: Eris
dwarfPlanets.description: Eris is slightly smaller than Pluto but more massive. It takes 557 Earth years to orbit the Sun!
dwarfPlanets.funFact: Eris's discovery led to the reclassification of Pluto! It orbits the Sun with an extremely elliptical path taking it from 38 to 98 AU away.

dwarfPlanets.name: Makemake
dwarfPlanets.description: Makemake is the second-brightest dwarf planet. It's the goddess of fertility in Rapa Nui mythology.
dwarfPlanets.funFact: Makemake has a moon called MK 2 that was discovered hiding behind the dwarf planet in 2015!

dwarfPlanets.name: Haumea
dwarfPlanets.description: Haumea is a unique egg-shaped dwarf planet with a rapid rotation. It spins so fast it's being torn apart!
dwarfPlanets.funFact: Haumea completes a full rotation in just 3.9 hours - the fastest rotating dwarf planet known! It's stretching into an elongated shape.

missions.name: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
missions.description: First humans on the Moon with Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin
missions.achievements: Humans set foot on the Moon

missions.name: Spirit & Opportunity Rovers
missions.achievements: Discovered evidence of water on Mars

missions.name: Curiosity Rover
missions.description: NASA's Mars Science Laboratory exploring Gale Crater
missions.achievements: Discovered organic molecules in Martian rock

missions.name: Perseverance Rover & Ingenuity
missions.description: Latest Mars rover with the first aerial helicopter

missions.name: Pioneer 10 & 11 Probes
missions.description: First probes to reach Jupiter and Saturn

missions.name: Voyager 1 & 2
missions.description: Grand Tour of the solar system

missions.name: Artemis Program
missions.description: Return humans to the Moon and establish lunar base

missions.name: Human Mars Mission
missions.description: First humans to set foot on Mars

timeline.title: Solar System Formation
timeline.description: The solar system forms from a collapsing molecular cloud. The Sun ignites nuclear fusion.

timeline.title: Giant Impact
timeline.description: A Mars-sized body collides with Earth, creating the Moon from debris.

timeline.title: Early Earth
timeline.description: Heavy bombardment period ends. Oceans begin forming as temperature drops.

timeline.title: First Life
timeline.description: Earliest evidence of microbial life on Earth appears in rocks.

timeline.title: Great Oxidation Event
timeline.description: Photosynthetic organisms begin filling atmosphere with oxygen, changing Earth's chemistry.

timeline.title: Cambrian Explosion
timeline.description: Complex multicellular life rapidly diversifies in oceans.

timeline.title: K-Pg Extinction
timeline.description: Asteroid impact wipes out dinosaurs, allowing mammals to thrive.

timeline.title: Early Humans
timeline.description: Early hominins walk upright in Africa.

timeline.title: Space Age Begins
timeline.description: Yuri Gagarin becomes first human in space aboard Vostok 1.

timeline.title: Moon Landing
timeline.description: Apollo 11 astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin land on the Moon.

timeline.title: Mars Pathfinder
timeline.description: First rover successfully explores Mars, sending back panoramic images.

timeline.title: Current Exploration
timeline.description: Multiple rovers and probes exploring Mars, Venus, and beyond. Search for life continues.
